channel.title: Blog
channel.description: Linked and downloadable resources in the areas of world history, genocide and teaching.

item.title: Interwar & Dictators Curriculum
item.description:
If a project sounds interesting but you are missing an associated reading or need help understanding how it works and what the end product is, please let me know - I would love to help.

Downloads for World History: Unit 6, Rise of the Dictators & the Interwar Period

item.title: Great War Curriculum
item.description:
A smattering of activities and tools for teaching about the first world war. (Also, the google ads were bugging me, and since I don’t believe they will lead me down the path of financial independence, I deleted them.)

Downloads for World History: Unit 5, The Great War

item.title: Imperialism Curriculum
item.description:
Readings and activities for use in teaching 19th c. European imperialism.

Downloads for World History: Unit 4, European Imperialism

item.title: Industrial Revolution Curriculum
item.description:
Some tests, projects and handouts for teaching the Industrial Revolution.

Downloads for World History: Unit 3, Industrial Revolution & Modern Ideologies

item.title: Revolutionary Era Curriculum
item.description: Here are some exams, a project and a map activity for the Revolutionary Era. Downloads for World History: Unit 2, Revolutionary Era

item.title: French Revolution Curriculum
item.description:
Here are some readings, activities and exams I’ve used:

Downloads for World History: Unit 2, Revolutionary Era

item.title: Foundations Curriculum
item.description:
Here are activities I’ve used and created for introducing major influences on the modern world - religion, government, and philosophy. Most are original, but if I have left off credit somewhere, please let me know so that I can fix it. Please leave the author’s name on the work if you do use it.

Unit 1 - Foundations of the Modern World

item.title: Classroom Organization
item.description:
Here are some .pdf documents I’ve made and collected for organizing the start of my world history class each year. Please leave the author’s name on items if you use them. If you find something especially useful, or are looking for a particular item, please let me know.

Downloads - Here are the ones I have added today:
Ten Commandments of History Writing - Schlabach
Essay Rubric - Student’s Friend
Letter of Introduction for 10th Grade World History Classes
World History Syllabus
Partner Syllabus Quiz
Specific Sub Plans
General Sub Information
Unit Variety Checklist
Interactive Notebook Information
Class Policies
Year Plan for 10th Grade World History
Unit 1 Outline for 10th Grade World History
Honors World History Option

item.title: Downloads & Curriculum
item.description:
I have a storage unit full of curriculum, teaching tips, classroom management and readings from teaching World History. I am putting here (it will take time) all the items that are free to use that I think would be of use to others teaching world history. Where there is credit given to the author, please leave it there. If I have failed to give credit and you know the original author, please let me know so that I can correct it.

Downloads for Teachers
New items added today:
Grade Update Contract 1
Grade Update Contract 2
Good Teaching - Haberman
Language Strategies for Groupwork
Learning Pyramid
Importance of Student Status - NYT
Seven Levels of Questioning
Multiple Abilities List
Multiple Abilities Bingo
Get-To-Know-You Bingo
Road to Democracy Activity

item.title: Cold War Definitions
item.description: This is the last page to have initial content added to it . . . that means that I have over 280 pages with some sort of world history/genocide/teaching content on every one! Here are definitions for Cold War study: Definitions of the Cold War.
